intro: Mniopsis johnsonii, commonly known as the Johnson's mniopsis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
